feed.title: Category: Podcast | Freelance .NET Web Developer in Mumbai

entry.title: Podcast Episode # 6 : Frameworks & Languages for Web Development
entry.content:
SDP Show # 6 : Frameworks and languages for Web Development. Before choosing web development as your career you should really know what frameworks and programming languages suites your interest.

There are many programming languages and frameworks on which a web application is developed. So today’s podcast show is on Frameworks and Programming Languages.

entry.title: Podcast Episode # 5 : Basics of Client-Side Web Programming
entry.content:
Basics of Client-Side Web Programming. As a student or a newbie web developer learning client-side web development can get you overwhelmed.

So, today’s podcast show is on the basics of client-side web programming.

Client-Side web development has improved a lot over these years. The days of creating a web page using “td tr th table” tags have gone.

entry.title: Podcast Episode # 4 : Source Control and Basics of Git & GitHub
entry.content:
Are you new to source control? Today’s show is on Source control and the basics of Git & GitHub.

Revision control, source control or source code management plays a very important role in today’s software development process.

Students and developers should use source control for their projects because it allows distributed work in teams of any size, at different locations while avoiding any source code changes.

entry.title: Podcast Episode # 3 : Tools for Web Development
entry.content:
Tools for Web Development on the Windows Platform.

As a student or a newbie developer you should know what softwares should be used for web development on the Windows platform.

entry.title: Podcast Episode # 2 : Web Basics
entry.content:
Web Basics that every Student & Web Developer should know.

As a student and a web developer we usually browse the web all the time. But do we really know how the Web works under the hood or what are the pieces of technology that makes the web so easy to use and consume the oceanic information from it.
